item.title: Making Effective Altruism Enormous - EA Forum
item.description: Making Effective Altruism Enormous - EA Forum Some criticisms of EA have been that it’s too demanding. This seems wrong. Not only do very few effective altruists embrace a maximalist and burdensome utilitarian view about ethical obligations, but we should be happy to encourage consequentialist altruistic giving across domains, even if not optimal.

item.title: Why EAs Should Normalize Using Glassdoor - EA Forum
item.description: Why EAs Should Normalize Using Glassdoor - EA Forum Pros Matching: Allows EAs to find better matches when considering workplaces, leading to less turnover and general frustration when applying for/working at jobs.

item.title: Why Charities Usually Don't Differ Astronomically in Expected Cost-Effectiveness
item.description: Why Charities Usually Don’t Differ Astronomically in Expected Cost-Effectiveness Argument 1: Many types of flow-through effects Charities can succeed across different dimensions beyond cost-effectiveness.

item.title: Blake Richards on Why He is Skeptical of Existential Risk From AI - EA Forum
item.description: Blake Richards on Why He is Skeptical of Existential Risk From AI - EA Forum Training in a Domain is Better for [[Transfer Effects]] Than Training Across All Tasks The Gato paper from DeepMind actually shows, if you look at their data, that they’re still getting better transfer effects if you train in domain than if you train across all possible tasks.

item.title: London Travel Advice
item.description: London Travel Advice British Museum, the National Gallery, the Natural History Museum, the Tate, and the Victoria & Albert Museum TimeOut Magazine for Food [[Guide to Living in London]] Packing List Clothes Raincoat (water resistant) Warm coat Long sleeve shirts (3-4) Short sleeve shirts (2-3) Lighter sweaters/jackets (2-3, easy for layering) Warmer sweaters (1-2) Jeans/Leggings/Other pants (3-4) At least one outfit for formal occasions A set of workout clothes Pyjamas Swimsuit –in case you travel somewhere warm Underwear and socks (at least two weeks’ worth, and maybe 1-2 pairs of woollysocks) Accessories (scarves, jewelleryetc.

item.title: Why is Sanskrit the Best Language for AI?
item.description: Why is Sanskrit the Best Language for AI? Rick Briggs suggests that Sanskrit, an ancient form of communication, is a naturally spoken language with mechanics and grammatical rules that would allow an artificial intelligence to more accurately interpret sentences during linguistic analysis.
